Docs.summary: The Service Bus Management API includes operations for managing Service Bus namespaces.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.ServiceBus.Models.CheckNamespaceAvailabilityResponse> CheckAvailabilityAsync (string namespaceName, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

Docs.summary: Checks the availability of the given service namespace across all Windows Azure subscriptions. This is useful because the domain name is created based on the service namespace name. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj870968.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: The response to a query for the availability status of a namespace name.

Docs.summary: Creates a new service namespace. Once created, this namespace's resource manifest is immutable. This operation is idempotent. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj856303.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: The response to a request for a particular namespace.

Docs.summary: Deletes an existing namespace. This operation also removes all associated entities including queues, topics, relay points, and messages stored under the namespace. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj856296.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

Docs.returns: A response to a request for a list of namespaces.
